page.title: 02LANDSCAPE GEOLOGY SCRAPTOFT
page.content: The whole area is covered with boulder clay deposited during the Ice Age.Below the clay are beds of the Lower Lias (clays and limestone) which have been exposed by the stream.The valley floor is covered with alluvial deposits.The glacier from the Ice Age also left deposits of gravel which provided the sites for most villages in the area.These sites are well drained and safe from flooding. Villagers with gardens enjoy good soil conditions,for it is light and easily worked,but for those gardeners who live on the clay it is very different. There the soil is heavy and sticky when wet and as hard as iron when dry. The area is however very fertile and farmers find that they can grow grass or corn equally well on the different soils.
